Course Description: THIS IS THE SECOND IN A SEQUENCE OF TWO COURSES:  ACG 3101 AND ACG 3111.  THIS COURSE PRESENTS AN IN-DEPTH STUDY OF FINANCIAL REPORTING CONCEPTS AND GENERALLY ACCEPTED PRACTICE FOR CURRENT LIABILITIES, LONG-TERM LIABILITIES, LEASES, PENSIONS, INCOME TAXES, REVENUE RECOGNITION, THE STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS, AND STOCKHOLDERS EQUITY AND EARNINGS PER SHARE.  EMPHASIS ON ANALYZING FINANCIAL EVENTS AND THE CONSEQUENCES OF FINANCIAL REPORTING ALTERNATIVES.  PREREQUISITE: ACG 3101.  3 SEMESTER HOURS CREDIT.
Textbook(s):
1. INTERMEDIATE ACCOUNTING, 12TH EDITION, KIESO AND WEYGANDT, JOHN WILEY AND SONS.
2. FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING OBJECTIVE QUESTIONS AND EXPLANATIONS, 7TH EDITION, 1996, GLEIM AND COLLINS, ACCOUNTING PUBLICATIONS, INC..
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
